data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3686626,"name":"","username":"Ladle","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/l/5fc32e/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-07-21T23:19:20.436Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eHi, I have a minimal setup running on a minibot. It has a LabVIEW RoboRIO, \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003ePDP\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"CTRE's Power Distribution Panel\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e 1.0, two Talon SRX controllers, and a LaserCAN all on the same bus. I have the latest version of both libgrappleFRC and GrappleHook installed. The RoboRIO is on the newest firmware. I’ve tried multiple different methods and inserted the user code into my Java project, yet GrappleHook refuses to connect to the robot. This is my first time using Chief Delphi, so if I broke one of the rules in my topic post, I sincerely apologize.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-07-21T23:19:42.847Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":126,"readers_count":125,"score":85.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":504508,"topic_slug":"grapplehook-not-connecting-to-roborio","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":76538,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/grapplehook-not-connecting-to-roborio/504508/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3686639,"name":"Xavier E.","username":"Xavbro","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/xavbro/{size}/6806_2.png","created_at":"2025-07-21T23:42:12.918Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eHi there! I’m not sure if you’ve already tried this but one thing we tried when setting up the LaserCAN is plugging the \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eCAN\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Controller Area Network\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e wire from the LaserCAN directly into the RIO. We did this just to configure it, and update firmware and it worked.
